pages.text: Rituals are a way of unlocking the wild energy of nature and harnessing it for a specific purpose.$(br2)The primary device used in rituals is a $(l:crafting/pyres)Pyre$(), and it is upon this pyre that the five necessary ingredients to perform the ritual are placed by right-clicking or throwing. (right click again to remove items).

Lighting the pyre is the final step to begin the ritual.$(br2)Once the correct ingredients are placed on the pyre, the HUD will information about the ritual.$(br2)$(info) It can then be started with a $(l:rituals/fire_starter)flint-and-steel or other fire starters$().$(br2)Before some rituals can function, they require additional components to be placed near the pyre.

$(info) Some require $(l:rituals/standing_stones)standing stones, runed pillars$(), or $(l:rituals/catalyst_plates)catalyst plates$() to direct energy.$(br2)There are a small number of rituals that require components in addition to those mentioned, but those will be specified in the entry for the ritual itself.$(br2)$(info) In the event that you wish to end a ritual early, you can pour a bucket of water on it.

pages.title: Ritual Tiers
pages.text: ($(o)See $(l:rituals/tiers)Ritual Tiers$())$(br2)Some rituals require additional components, these will be displayed in each ritual entry as a multiblock image.$(br2)Because of these additional requirements, rituals can be classed in tiers, with the tier number being equivalent to the number of components required.$(br2)It is, therefore, possible to list $(l:rituals/tiers)rituals by tier$().

pages.title: Ritual Specifics
pages.text: All ritual entries will list specific details. The type of details provided will vary depending on the type of ritual, but it will generally list the size and duration of the ritual, etc.$(br2)More complex rituals will also list details about how their individual functions operate and how frequently.

pages.title: Visualisation
pages.text: ($(o)See $(l:rituals/visualisation)Ritual Visualisation$())$(br2)If a ritual has a specific radius or cube size, it's possible to have the exact range of the ritual displayed in-world.$(br2)To do so, sneak-right-click a $(l:crafting/pyres)pyre$() that has ritual ingredients in it (or displays a previously activated ritual) with a $(l:crafting/knives)knife$().

pages.title: Automation
pages.text: ($(o)See $(l:rituals/automation)Ritual Automation$())$(br2)Ingredients for rituals can be stored in a chest beneath the pyre, and they will be consumed from there automatically whenever the pyre is empty.$(br2)An already-started ritual will automatically continue if new ingredients are provided, but nearby sources of flame will also be consumed to start a ritual.
